definition: older female servant/amah

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
ma/mom/mother
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Lucy: If you're ever in an argument, you can always trump with a dead mother.
sentences.chinese: 如果相持不下就使出你死老媽子的絕招。

sentences.english: I'm too smart to believe in that kind of old wives' tale.
sentences.chinese: 我纔不會傻到相信那種老媽子的鬼話。

sentences.english: Does not need to guess that, understood at a glance is result which the female servant creates.
sentences.chinese: 不用猜，一看就知道是老媽子造成的結果。

sentences.english: You look like my old maidservant at this time.
sentences.chinese: 你這個時候看起來真像個老媽子。

sentences.english: My grandmothers didn't do anything but keep house and serve everybody.
sentences.chinese: 我的祖母輩們都沒事可幹，除了顧家和當老媽子。

sentences.english: Jim: You look like my old maidservant at this time.
sentences.chinese: 你這個時候看起來真像個老媽子。

definition: variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
lit. to work like an ox, to work like a horse; fig. to work extremely hard
the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zhu3 cheng2 shu2 fan4

definition: marriage by capture/bride kidnapping
to face the wall and ponder about one's misdeeds/to stand in the corner (punishment)/(fig.) to examine one's conscience
what remains unseen is deemed to be clean/what the eye doesn't see, the heart doesn't grieve over (idiom)
to make fun of/to seek diversion
reckless/extremely daring
son-in-law (used by wife's family)/uncle (husband of father's sister)
hourly worker/hourly job
conjoined twins
arranged betrothal of minors
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
variant of 慪氣|怄气[ou4 qi4]
lit. rarely seen, very strange (idiom); to express amazement due to lack of experience/naive expression of excitement due to ignorance
to act as a matchmaker
